text: Almut Hege-Schöll (born as Almut Hege) is a former German curler and curling coach. She is a former World champion () and three-time (, , ). She competed at the 1988 Winter Olympics when curling was a demonstration sport. ==Awards== * Frances Brodie Award: 1990World Curling Federation - Frances Brodie Award (one and only German for today). ==Teams== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Season ! scope="col"| Skip ! scope="col"| Third ! scope="col"| Second ! scope="col"| Lead ! scope="col"| Alternate ! scope="col"| Events |- ! scope="row"| 1980–81 | Almut Hege || Suzanne Koch || Renate Räderer || Ingeborg Stock || || (9th) |- ! scope="row"| 1982–83 | Almut Hege || Josefine Einsle || Suzanne Koch || Petra Tschetsch || || (9th) WCC CR 1982 |- ! scope="row"| 1983–84 | Almut Hege || Josefine Einsle || Suzanne Koch || Petra Tschetsch || || |- ! scope="row"| 1984–85 | Almut Hege || Josefine Einsle || Suzanne Koch || Petra Tschetsch || || |- ! scope="row"| 1985–86 | Almut Hege || Petra Tschetsch || Suzanne Fink || Josefine Einsle || || (6th) |- ! scope="row"| 1986–87 | Andrea Schöpp || Almut Hege || Monika Wagner || Elinore Schöpp || || |- ! scope="row"| 1987–88 | Andrea Schöpp || Almut Hege-Schöll || Monika Wagner || Suzanne Fink || || OG 1988 (demo) (4th) |- ! scope="row"| 1989–90 | Almut Hege-Schöll || Suzanne Fink || Stefan Rossler || Ina Räderer || Josefine Einsle (WCC) || GWCC 1990 (5th) |- ! scope="row"| 1991–92 | Josefine Einsle || Petra Tschetsch- Hiltensberger || Elisabeth Ländle || Karin Fischer || Almut Hege-Schöll || (8th) |} ==Record as a coach of national teams== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Year ! scope="col"| Tournament, event ! scope="col"| National team ! scope="col"| Place |- | 2008 || 2008 World Junior Curling Championships || (junior women) ||10 |} ==Private life== She is from curlers family: Almut's daughter Pia-Lisa Schöll and nephew Sebastian Stock are well-known curlers too. Married with Franz Schöll.Schöll Franz A. Dipl.-Ing.
